unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Bank Lines
question_text: A bank has kept records for several years on the number of people in line on Fridays at 3 p.m., as presented in the probability distribution below. X 0 1 2 3 4 P(X) 0.1 0.3 0.4 0.1 0.1 What is the probability that on any given Friday at 3 p.m. there will be at most $3$ people waiting in line?
